lexUnit.name: rotate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to move in a circle round an axis.

sentence.text: It is then rotated 90 degrees clockwise about its lowest corner .
The second rectangle is first imagined as superimposed on the first then moved vertically downwards 1 cm and rotated 45 degrees clockwise about its own top left corner .
Rotate the cutter once around the pipe and tighten the wheel a little more .
A carrier is fixed by knots or capstan windings to the line , and it can be raised or lowered simply by rotating the secondary kiteline around the triangle .
Any possible variation of dose delivered from position to position was eliminated by rotating the entire assembly at six revolutions per minute .
Learn to rotate the left forearm properly at the start of the backswing .
The molecules of your body , because of the way they are made up , possess the ability to rotate polarized light in a leftward direction .
Try rotating your hips in all the different directions possible , facing both forwards and backwards .
This means that you could for example , take the pieces of garment originally designed for conventional knitting and rotate them through 90 degrees to get a pattern for sideways knitting .
In a simple dynamo , an electric current is produced in a coil of wire by rotating the coil between opposite magnetic poles .
Sliding the mouse over the desk top beside the computer rotates a direction-sensitive ball inside it which in turn moves a pointer over the screen .
Compare this positive reading with the negative minimum found by rotating the sensor by 180° in the same 67° plane to the horizontal .
Place the sensor on a flat surface and rotate it slowly through 360° .
Tony 's Beaver still has its original inertia starter using a comparatively weak electric motor to spin a small flywheel up to high rpm , when the stored energy rotates the engine .
The others watched Blunt rotate his head .
In the first exercise , the arms are gently rotated 35 times , first the right arm , then the left .
Pictures can be rotated about any axis .
In such a case , the tube must be rotated before the elastic sail tensioner is stretched into position in the nock slot .
Many mills met their fate in storms when they were ` tailwinded " , in other words , the wind caught the sails from behind after suddenly changing direction before the sails could be rotated .
The karateka then pivots halfway round on the ball of the left foot , while rotating the entire body forward .
